name: UBX-RXM-COR
description: This message shows information on received differential correction input messages. It is output upon successful parsing of a differential correction input message, irrespective of whether the parsed message is supported/used by the receiver.

fields.name: statusInfo
fields.description:
Message input status information (bitmask). This 4-byte field contains multiple bitfields:
- bits 4...0 (5 bits): protocol (Input correction data protocol: 0=Unknown, 1=RTCM3, 2=SPARTN, 30=UBX-RXM-QZSSL6)
- bits 6...5 (2 bits): errStatus (Error status of the received correction message content: 0=Unknown, 1=Error-free, 2=Erroneous)
- bits 8...7 (2 bits): msgUsed (Status of receiver using the input message: 0=Unknown, 1=Not used, 2=Used)
- bits 24...9 (16 bits): correctionId (Identifier for the correction stream: 0-4095 for RTCM3, 0xFFFF for other types)
- bit 25 (1 bit): msgTypeValid (Validity of the msgType field)
- bit 26 (1 bit): msgSubTypeValid (Validity of the msgSubType field)
- bit 27 (1 bit): msgInputHandle (Receiver has input handling support for this message: 0=No, 1=Yes)
Refer to the manual for specific bit assignments and interpretations.

fields.name: msgType
fields.description: Message type. The validity of this field is indicated by bit 25 of the statusInfo field.

fields.name: msgSubType
fields.description: Message subtype. The validity of this field is indicated by bit 26 of the statusInfo field.
